title: (Amendment) Act 2017 (No. 5 of 2017)) of the Health Act 1970 (No. 1 of 1970),
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Services (Amendment)
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Services (Amendment) 

Regulations 2020. 

(2) The Principal Regulations, the Health Services (Drug Payment Scheme) 
Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 577 of 2017) and these Regulations may be cited 
together as the Health Services Regulations 1972 to 2020.

title: (Amendment) Act 2017 (No. 5 of 2017)) of the Health Act 1970 (No. 1 of 1970),
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 November 2020.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 November 2020.

title: (Amendment) Act 2017 (No. 5 of 2017)) of the Health Act 1970 (No. 1 of 1970),
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means the Health Services Regulations 1972 (S.I. No. 
88 of 1972); 

“Regulations of 2019” means the Health Services (Drug Payment Scheme) 
Regulation 2017 (S.I. No. 59 of 2019).

title: (Amendment) Act 2017 (No. 5 of 2017)) of the Health Act 1970 (No. 1 of 1970),
heading: 4. Regulation 6 (as amended by Regulation 4 of the Regulations of 2019)
text_raw:
4. Regulation 6 (as amended by Regulation 4 of the Regulations of 2019) 

of the Principal Regulations is amended— 

(a) 

(b) 

in paragraph (1), by substituting “€114” for “€124”, and 

in paragraph (2), by substituting “€114” for “€124” in both places 
where it occurs.

title: (Amendment) Act 2017 (No. 5 of 2017)) of the Health Act 1970 (No. 1 of 1970),
heading: 5. The Regulations of 2019 are revoked.
text_raw:
5. The Regulations of 2019 are revoked. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Regulations. 

[463] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 October, 2020. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 
Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 October, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [463]

title: (Amendment) Act 2017 (No. 5 of 2017)) of the Health Act 1970 (No. 1 of 1970),
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend Regulation 6 of the Health Service Regulations 1972 
(as substituted by Regulation 4 of the Regulations of 2017 and subsequently 
amended by Regulation 4 of the Regulations of 2019), by reducing to the 
monthly co-payment threshold from €124, to €114 in any calendar month, for 
approved prescribed medicines or other items supplied under the Drug Payment 
Scheme. 

The Health Services (Amendment) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 59 of 2019), 
which reduced the monthly co-payment from €134 (as provided for under 
Regulation 4 of 2017), to €124, are revoked and replaced by these Regulations. 

These Regulations come into operation on 1 November 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [463] 5
